website_summaries.verdict: A two-in-one teething toy that helps introduce good oral hygiene at an early age.
pros: Colorful design is captivating and easy to hold
Soft food-grade silicone bristles massage sore, itchy gums
Perfectly shaped for hard to reach areas in little mouths
cons: Bristles may be bitten off once teeth come in, requiring extra vigilance on behalf of parents

customer_reviews.title: Is this the thing that supposed to be replaced like every 3 month or something
customer_reviews.text: CHOKING DANGER!! My son is 7month now, and he loves this toy. However, this morning I found a mysterious little piece on his playing mat and wondered what it was. Guess what, It turned out to be a broken silicone part that came out of the teether!! Very dangerous for choking!!!!!! Is this the thing that supposed to be replaced like every 3 month or something? Wear and tear...... doesnt make sense to me at all
customer_reviews.author: Yumi

customer_reviews.title: It’s a fake. Don’t Buy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fake. Not a product of BABY BANANA.In the third photo, the banana without plastic packaging was bought by me at Target. It is genuine. .There's a BabyBanana printed on the banana. The fake one doesn't have a printed babybanana. The fake one is smaller and darker, and looks bad quality .
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Dog hair/human hair/dust/crap sticks to this like glue
customer_reviews.text: I honestly hate this product. First of all, when it arrived, it had stringy pieces of silicone hanging off of it. It looked like silicone but also kind of like he sticky clear stuff they use to stick credit cards to letters when they mail them out. Second and more importantly, it seems like this material PICKS UP EVERY SINGLE PIECE OF DOG HAIR, HUMAN HAIR, DIRT DUST AND CRAP WITHIN A 100ft radius. It's impossible to keep clean so why would I let my baby put this in her mouth. Useless product. Save yourself some money and hours of time trying to scrub it clean.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin F.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for 5 month old prior premie
customer_reviews.text: Got the baby banana and Cornelius. Both are good, but my baby is small and her mouth is small. For her size, the baby banana works better than Cornelius. All other teething toys were too big to fit in her mouth (necklace beads, giraffe, Kiki the elephant, etc) the only thing that worked previously was a small rubber tipped spoon we got from the hospital at discharge. But the banana is perfect! Cornelius is slightly larger and will probably be good for when she is 6 months old (works now also but she likes the banana better). She's currently 5 months old and about 17-18 pounds. Banana and corn photos both attached for size comparison.
customer_reviews.author: WangATop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous Toy!
customer_reviews.text: We had 2 of these banana teethers because they helped my daughter overcome most of her teething pain from about the age of 5 months to 17 months. I bought our second one because we lost the first. We had it for just a few months and I noticed one of the bristles was missing. I really hope my daughter didn't swallow it!!! It's such a shame because we loved this toy and recommended it to so many friends and family members. I especially loved the fact that it was made in the US. DON'T buy this toy. Go for something safer instead.
customer_reviews.author: chances28

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart- be careful so they won’t swallow it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Parent please BE CAREFUL! My daughter (less than 2 yrs) swallowed little broken part of the toothbrush. I have notice one broken part and freaked out! This is the second time it happens, for the first time I thought we had it for a while and it makes sense, but the second time it happened within less than a couple of weeks - I would NOT recommend buying it again!
customer_reviews.author: Limlim128

customer_reviews.title: CHOKING HAZARD!!!
customer_reviews.text: My son started using this teether toy when he was ~5 months old. He just turned 9 months old and got his first 2 teeth a couple of weeks ago. Today, one of the bristle on the banana had fallen off and our baby most likely swallowed it. We are monitoring him now and hoping everything is okay. I don't see how this is an appropriate teething toy for babies 0+ when small pieces like the bristles on the banana can easily break into their mouths. The idea of the teether is great, but I would never use this product again due to safety.
customer_reviews.author: sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Her new best friend
customer_reviews.text: Ah i have tried everything to ease my little ones pain for teething. This banana is a life saver! She chews on it all day long and it holds up! We have had it for a few weeks now and she just can’t get enough. Bristles are holding up strong. Her tiny fingers can hold it with ease and it washes super easily. She’s transitioning to solid foods and the dish brush takes any dried food off in seconds. Will be buying the octopus next! Thanks for easing her pain! Baby approved! Mommy approved!
customer_reviews.author: a raven & her writing desk.

customer_reviews.title: We've tried a bunch and this one is a big hit!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what I would do without this handy-dandy, little blessing of a teether-toothbrush. I did not expect to use it for teething but I most certainly would be a bit more frazzled without the assistance of 'Baby Banana' toothbrush. My 5 month old granddaughter prefers this to every other teether and she can easily grasp and hold onto it (when she wants to!) The downside is how much fuzz/hair/lint gets stuck in the soft silicone bristles. Ugh. I guess this is the case with most things that are heavily salivated upon in a house containing pets. C'est la vi! I'm sure it will work great as a beginner toothbrush also!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie V.

customer_reviews.title: Yes-- this banana does its job!
customer_reviews.text: Great product to introduce brushing teeth to baby. And while my 9 month old likes chewing on it, after a couple of minutes she completely loses interest in it. Baby is able to hold the banana very easily so I don't have to worry too much about her dropping it-- a definite plus! The product seems very safe and durable, and it is easy to clean-- so I feel confident that it's safe for baby to put in her mouth. I purchased this product to clean baby's first few teeth and get her used to brushing them. The banana, I'm happy to report, does just that.
customer_reviews.author: K.H.

customer_reviews.title: Bought because of the reviews -- Our baby isn't thrilled.
customer_reviews.text: Our baby is generally a great baby. She's just poked through her first tooth (with others behind). The reviews on this product were so good, I really hoped it would do the trick for her (among other things). Unfortunately, she could care less. Maybe other children love it, but she has 0 interest in the product. We've tried multiple times over 2 weeks to see if she'd want to "play" with it -- no luck. She resorts to grabbing a normal toy or her fist and rubbing it against her gums to help sooth her.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Soper

customer_reviews.title: 5 mo old bit off 2 white pieces...
customer_reviews.text: I loved this teether and it was my daughter's favorite for the last month.... just yesterday I picked it up to wash it and noticed 2 of the white pieces on the toothbrush part of the teether were bitten off! I quickly swiped her mouth and found one of the pieces in her mouth. She may have swallowed the other piece because I can't find it. Clearly an awful product if my 5 mo old can bite off (she has no teeth) and ingest pieces of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Great for introducing dental hygiene
customer_reviews.text: As a dental hygienist, it was important to me to start my baby on dental products early. I used this toothbrush before he even had teeth, on his gums to get him used to brushing and things being used inside his mouth. Now that he has one tooth coming in, I use a small baby toothbrush with bristles and he smiles and laughs anytime he sees the toothbrush coming and when I brush. Definitely recommend for early introduction to brushing, and for baby to play with. Once baby gets a tooth you will want to get a brush with actual bristles to get the plaque off the teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Mel KTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it! It's a fake one.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy it! It's a fake one. 1, the packaging: there is only a very cheap plastic bag outside of the teether, not the packaging shown in product pictures. And you couldn’t find its brand anywhere. 2, it is much softer than the authentic one. 3, it smells very badly. 4, there is no words on the body and the little dots on the bottom are missing as well. I couldn’t understand how the seller could send me something like this, which is supposed to be in my baby’ mouth in daily basis. Totally a waste of my time.
customer_reviews.author: Yanhong Z.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect teether and beginning toothbrush!
customer_reviews.text: This is my daughters FAVORITE teether! She loves it so much that she even sleeps with it at night... We brushed her teeth with it when she was really little, but now she just chews on it for teething relief. It is soft, strong, and easy to clean. The multiple shapes and areas are perfect for little hands to hold, and little mouths to chew on. She was able to pick off some of the bristles with her fingernails, but she had had that banana for several months. I bought a new one, and it has held up perfectly for the last 3 months. This is definitely going to be a go-to for any future babies we have!
customer_reviews.author: Ariel H

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Our 8 month old daughter LOVES this. By far her best teethed and is great to use to “brush” her gums to keep her desensitized to having me put something in her mouth. Small hairs/fuzz do get trapped in between the bristles pretty easy since material seems to stick to silicone but it does wash off easily. Would recommend this product to anyone with an infant/toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Soft bristles feel good on gums.
customer_reviews.text: My 14 month old LO loves this thing! It is his favorite part of our bedtime routine! I handed it to him to play with, and it went straight into his mouth... the soft bristles feel good on his gums! He does a good job getting all of his teeth, and his gums where they are comming in! After reading the other reviews, about the bristles coming off I will keep a close eye... but so far no issues with that, we only use it 3 times a day after breakfast lunch and dinner for about 5 min each time, closely monitored! Great product for learning a routine! We Love our banana!
customer_reviews.author: Tina Louise

customer_reviews.title: Love Banana!
customer_reviews.text: We love the banana! It’s great for tiny ones that are getting their teeth or just to use to help for babies to keep their mouth clean. It is small and easy for littles to hold and get to their mouth. We stuck ours in the fridge/freezer for short amounts of time to help soothe the gums due to pain of those teeth coming in. Great product, we definitely have a few laying around
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: This was our baby’s intro to teeth brushing. It did the job. It was fun bright and easy to hold. It did not fall apart even after all the biting he did to it. The rubber component made brushing fun/tolerable. We had previously tried a regular tooth brush and he hated it. Once he graduated from this size we bought the next version up to ensure a good continued experience.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great teether without making any mess
customer_reviews.text: Our baby starts knowing how to use it at 5 months. He can hold it with his hands easily, and keep chewing on it. It was just the right size for the baby. Won't create any extra mess on the baby's face.
customer_reviews.author: Jiabei L.

customer_reviews.title: My baby's favorite teether!
customer_reviews.text: My baby (8 months) loves this teether so much that I bought a second banana, the octopus, and the corn. This is by far his favorite teething toy. It's the perfect size for little hands, and the "peel" part keeps him from pushing it into his mouth too far. I haven't had any problems with the silicon bristles breaking off, like other reviewers have mentioned, but if that happens, I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: meganmalia

customer_reviews.title: Dual purpose toothbrush & teether
customer_reviews.text: I saw this for awhile and was hoping it might arrive as a gift since it seemed somewhat novelty but I never got it and finally decided to just purchase it and I'm glad I did! My son started using at 5 months and took to it immediately. It has one side of soft bristles he likes to chew on and lets me brush his gums and the other side has tiny ridges, perfect for rubbing inside of gums. Highly recommend and a great baby gift!
customer_reviews.author: M. Zombro

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: The instructions say it's for brushing only, but I find it to be better for chewing as a teether. I would imagine a baby toothbrush to be soft bristles, whereas this is hard silicone. My baby loves sucking on the banana, peel, and little handles. Due to the silicone material, it does catch hairs and dust easily on it, but that just comes with the territory of the material itself. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Alex F

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! My 6mo daughter loves It
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! My 6mo daughter loves It! She will not quit chewing it and it's so adorable to watch. I don't know why I didn't buy it earlier. Its a must have. Easy to hold and the material is very soft and nice to chew. Easy to clean too. Because its silicone dust sticks to it easily and pretty strongly, you have to wash it to get the specks of dust off. Please buy if you have a 6mo or older, infact as soon as they start to put things in their mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tether!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his nanner! He didn’t like any of the other teethers we got (he likes the corn one like this though) and he will chew on this for usually a whole car ride. The handles are easy to hold and clip links to. We had to buy another because the original one got lost in the move and he was so happy he had another nanner to chew on! He also likes his toothbrush and maybe the banana had something to do with it. Either way this is going on the “must have gift” for our friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: BrittanyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Fun little training tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a little 'toy' for grandson, and my son taught him to brush his teeth with it. Now the grandson picks it up among his things and starts scrubbing his teeth with it. He (12-months old) was fascinated to see adults brush their teeth and this little banana training-brush is perfect for babies/toddlers to mimic the motions of dental hygiene. I really believe, because of this early exposure to brushing, he'll transition quickly to the concept of brushing with toothpaste to keep his teeth clean.
customer_reviews.author: flip@60

customer_reviews.title: Good but maybe not safe
customer_reviews.text: My baby liked this banana infant toothbrush. I used it to brush his teeth when he was 3 months. This toothbrush gently massages little teeth and gums with soft silicone bristles. It has easy-to-grasp banana peel handles. Unfortunately, one bristle fall down after one month use, maybe because my baby bite too hard. It is not very safe.
customer_reviews.author: Jush Owen

customer_reviews.title: It did it’s job
customer_reviews.text: Our 5 month old used it regularly for about a month. We liked that it has handles to easily hold. She also used both ends (the bristles and the handle) to teeth on. It’s a thick and long teether, so it was definitely efficient at reaching all angles in her mouth. The only con - the “bristles” broke off easily after a few weeks. So you have to make sure they don’t swallow it.
customer_reviews.author: DommiesBlessed

customer_reviews.title: Great Initial Teether and Toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: Love this banana toothbrush! Great for soothing babies with initial teething discomfort-not recommended for babies to chew on if they have already popped teeth as the little rubber nubs could break off and pose a choking hazard. We used this for our little one when she was popping her first teeth and needed an easy first toothbrush. TIP: Great to attach to pacifier clips to provide a soothing distraction while out and about. Simply loop the pacifier end of the pacifier clip around the banana peel and you're good to go! My only dislike is that it easily attracts dirt, hair, fuzz...pretty much anything. Wash frequently with soap and water and let air dry.
customer_reviews.author: Practical Mama

customer_reviews.title: Infant/toddler banana toothbrush/teether
customer_reviews.text: Two of my daughters now have these to brush my grandson’s mouth and now teeth. One is 10 months and the other is 8 months. It’s a Great way to introduce them to getting used to daily brushing and they’re able to hold onto it themselves too. I highly recommend this product as my eldest daughter used this for her son so I bought one for my other daughter to use for her lil one.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: If your child likes teething toys to chew on this will be good for you
customer_reviews.text: My son is 9 months old. He seems to not care one way or the other about this. He likes to pick it up and bang it around on stuff sometimes, but I rarely see him using this as a teether. But to be fair, I rarely see him using any teething toys (and I've tried quite a few)....he prefers to just chew on his fists or try to chew on my arms. If your child uses teething toys he/she will probably like this better than mine did. I have been trying to use this as a toothbrush with just water to get him used to the idea of brushing his teeth. Will switch to a regular baby toothbrush soon.
customer_reviews.author: christina

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Why doesn’t amazon allow photo reviews anymore? My son is 8 months old and has two bottom teeth, and one top front tooth in, with three more tops about to go. I wanted something like a tooth brush to keep his gums and teeth relatively clean. We got this today and he is already loving it. Definitely a great purchase
customer_reviews.author: InnocentBystander

customer_reviews.title: These are a must for the kids that are  teething
customer_reviews.text: Gave it to my daughters around Xmas one we’ll both had 7 months olds kids one a boy and the other a girl they well the kids seem to like these tooth brushes Oh one more thing the other day I have one daughter has two kids so her older brother was trying to use it the brush his teeth the guy is 2 1/2 thought it was funny 😄
customer_reviews.author: steven s.

customer_reviews.title: My child loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for when my infant got their first teeth. Since it's a banana, it's engaging and the rounded "peels" make it very easy to hold. At first I just let him suck on it, but then upgraded to actual brushing. Now as an 18 month old, we brush our teeth together and he still loves it! I put durability as only 3 stars, because as he got more teeth, he learned he could chew off some bristles! Sadly I did not realize this until he had done several, leading me to believe he swallowed them.
customer_reviews.author: FinanceAdvisorandTheaterPerformer

customer_reviews.title: Super a-peeling! :)
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this toothbrush! *Easy to hold : for both me and also for the baby *Cleans well: super easy to wash and air dry *Fun! : my baby looks forward to getting his teeth brushed since it also massages his gums and the shape of a banana is fun too! Great addition to my solids routine and to start him on the right path to oral health!
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: I wish i got this earlier
customer_reviews.text: I wish i got this earlier!! My baby loves it and it is his favorite teether so far. My LO’s been fussy and i tried so many different types of teeters but skept this cause i just didn’t really like its design. But I feel so bad that I was so wrong! This is totally right one for teething babies!!!! So easy to hold and easy to put in mouth! If your little one is suffering from their teething, go for this one to ease their pain ;)
customer_reviews.author: Marylicious

customer_reviews.title: Literally our best baby purchase
customer_reviews.text: Baby’s favorite teething toy! unfortunately it’s also our dogs favorite teething toy and he’s already chewed apart 2. So now we have 5 as back ups just incase. 1 upstairs, 1 downstairs, 1 in diaper bag, etc. Baby literally can’t go with this. The design is amazing. Small enough to fit perfectly in little hands. The “peel” prevents the banana from going too far into baby’s mouth so you never have to worry about gagging or choking. The bristle must feel good on baby’s sore gums.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great first toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this. We use it special for "brushing" her teeth in the morning and evening, and she loves it. She grabs it and gets a good grip on it, and loves it even more. A very positive introduction to teeth brushing. We don't use it as a teether, but she seems to enjoy how it feels on her gums.
customer_reviews.author: mccomm

customer_reviews.title: Great teether!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great teether! As soon as we gave it to my daughter she was chewing on it right away and hardly put it down. The only downside is if there was food in her mouth, it would get stuck in the bristles and it was sometimes hard to get out. Other than that it's a really great product in I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: My baby's favorite teether. It is so easy for him to ...
customer_reviews.text: My baby's favorite teether. It is so easy for him to hold, it's light and it's got "banana handles". Fits his mouth well compared to his other ones. My only complaint is the material it's made out of. Tiny tiny dirt looking stuff off the couch, etc, gets stuck on it and it's so hard to get it off because the rubber material is "sticky"!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel H.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: By far his favorite "toy" and his favorite teether
customer_reviews.text: My son (7 months) is bonkers for this thing. By far his favorite "toy" and his favorite teether. His eyes light up with glee as soon as he sees I am handing it to him. He'll chew on it for ages. I would greatly recommend cleaning it often, (after every use if you're nuts like me) as baby drool builds up in the bristles, it would surely be easy to grow some yucky stuff if you just let this sit in the toy box. Even with the cleaning regimen, I'll be wrapping this up for every baby shower I go to for years. Such a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: LOOOOOOVE!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the only teething items my baby took to when she started teething. She first started teething at 7 weeks old so it was very hard to find teething toys that were small enough for her little mouth to gnaw on. Once we got this we immediately wanted to buy the rest in stock so we could be sure to have one with us everywhere we go. Easy for baby to grasp, small enough for little mouths and she's still able to enjoy it at 16 months. Will definitely be getting more.
customer_reviews.author: CandyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to keep clean
customer_reviews.text: My baby really likes this toy. However, it attracts lint, hair, and dirt like crazy. So for a mobile baby I don’t recommend it. It’s so hard to clean because everything sticks to it and gets inside the little rubber bristles. I don’t even want to give it to my baby because it’s dirty within minutes of cleaning it and giving it to her.
customer_reviews.author: Rwbana

customer_reviews.title: It's OK.
customer_reviews.text: My baby enjoys it, but the shape seems all wrong. The top half is long enough for them to gag on and you have to keep a strict eye on them. I watched as my baby got bored with one side, flipped it around and tried to stick the bottom half in her mouth. Since the handles are shaped the way that they are, it's easy to get it in, but not so easy pulling it out, as the handles catch in the cheeks. As long as I hold it for her it seems to be fine and she gets a good gum massage.
customer_reviews.author: Lani

customer_reviews.title: Best  ever made!
customer_reviews.text: The design of this is perfect! The placement of the baby friendly handles are exactly where they need to be for him to safely chew on either end while keeping it from going too deeply and choking him! It helped better than any other teether we tried! He has 5 teeth now and frantically chews it but there are still no signs of wear! He loves it! It also doubles a a tooth brush for his first little teeth!
customer_reviews.author: Selina P.

customer_reviews.title: Hey! It’s a Tiny Bendable Banana, woot woot!
customer_reviews.text: It’s small, it’s yellow, it bends, and it’s a banana! What’s more, your baby/toddler/child can bite on it to simulate the act of brushing. Which, in all honesty doesn’t really matter because you’ll end up brushing their teeth for them anyways. But, it can help alleviate those pesky teething issues plaguing toddlers across the land. We picked it up ‘cause it had totally radical reviews, and we wanted something for the little ones to bite on. After we’ve had it for a few years, some of the bristles have come off. Or I should say have been bitten off by curious little ones. The other (non-bristly) end also has some little nubs on it. Presumably for additional gum stimulation.
customer_reviews.author: Partyneverdies

customer_reviews.title: Perfect teether
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly in my sons hand. (6 months) Still uses today at 11 months. He has 4 teeth and we practice brushing them using the banana. It seemed to really help him when he is teething. I always get people at stores telling me how cute it is. The only minor issue, is the bristles are hard to clean if you get something stuck in there. He threw it in the grass, had issue trying to grit out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Training brush. yes....teether, no!
customer_reviews.text: I like this as a first time toothbrush but to call it a teether is a bit of a stretch. I cannot leave my baby with it by herself because she gags herself with it if I try to let her teeth with it... so as a teether, no, I wouldn't let a baby hold it on their own and use it as a teether. As a training brush, yes I think it's great and the bristles are nice and rubbery so it feels good on their gums.
customer_reviews.author: Josephine

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES this! We got it for him at around 4 months for teething; it was the only teething toy that he could actually hold himself at the time. He's over a year now (still uses it everyday) and 12 teeth later this thing is still holding up as perfect as the first day we got it. I just wash it by hand with hot water and dish soap and let it air dry to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Publy

customer_reviews.title: Unique, fun, and essential for teething babies
customer_reviews.text: Fun, amusing and easy to hold design. Provides enrichment for baby in more than one way. Bright colors, fruit/veggie shape helps child relate teething toy to real food, tooth brush texture is satisfying for baby's sore gums and helps them get practice for later brushing teeth. Fun for parents and baby. This is an absolute hit with my friend's baby.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie J

customer_reviews.title: Great for teething babies!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son who is 6 months old as a stocking stuffer. He goes crazy over it. The rubbery material is very soft and the bristle end feels great for them to chew on. He is just using it at a teether since he doesn't have any teeth yet but it definitely helps his sore gums. I really like the "handles" on the side. It lets him hold it easily on his own. He did have to learn not to put the entire end in his mouth causing him to gag, but be have tried key teethers, gel teethers, the giraffe, and others and so far this is his favorite!
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas

customer_reviews.title: So cute! And so dead!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my infant granddaughter who should be starting the teething process soon. Problem: I left the package on the coffee table. Not only did my puppy manage to bust into the packaging, she shredded the teether to bits. She didn't eat any, just ripped it up. Great for a teething baby. Not great for a puppy @@. Glad it is non-toxic.
customer_reviews.author: Bostonmama

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: After 3 month of using a tiny broken silicone part came out of the teether! Its dangurous if my baby swollow in. It should tell people to replace it at leaset every 3 month.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Amazing teether!
customer_reviews.text: My baby has about 5 different teethers and this is her favorite. She loves chewing on both ends because of the texture and her pain/mood usually improves after she is done. I haven’t had any issues with it and it is super easy to clean. I also thought it was cute that it smelt like a banana when you first open it although the smell disappeared almost immediately after I washed it before I gave it to me daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Gladys W

customer_reviews.title: Baby Loves This Toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: My son loves everything about this banana toothbrush! He loves the handles, he loves the rubbery bristles, and he loves how the bottom half (the yellow part) is squishy enough that he could bite down and gnaw on it when he can't turn it around to get to the bristles. He's currently teething, and I think gnawing on the bristles helps to ease the itchiness/pain he may be feeling. I've purchased quite a few toys in the past few months, and this one definitely stands out as a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect teething toy
customer_reviews.text: This is tough enough to go through 2 children. I think the dog took it a few times... but still looks great. With teething kids throwing this on carpets with animal hair, supermarket floors, or dirt at the playground it rinsed off with no effort. Perfect when running around. 5/6 month old was able to hold easy. They also liked the squeak it can make when being chewed on.
customer_reviews.author: Diego C.

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Great quality! My grandson absolutely loves his!!! A parent/baby must have!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love!!! Our friends bought one for our new grandson. He wasn’t big with a nuk, pretty much just for naps and bedtime. However, he been grabbing on to and noshing away on this since 4.5-5 months old! It’s great as a teether! Sooo easy for him to hold and the bristles seem to be very soothing on his gums as well! This is the 3rd one I have purchased to add to baby gifts!
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Great for teething
customer_reviews.text: My 7 month old seems to have a preference for this toy to chew on over all her others. She also like when I hold it and rub the brush part over her gums. The only downside is that we have a dog that sheds some and if she drops it... and all babies drop their toys.... dog hair and other dirt sticks to it far more than a cloth or wooden toy and it can be a bit hard to pick off.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Klarer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little hands
customer_reviews.text: My daughter uses this with ease. She loves when we let her "brush" her teeth (all six of them) in the morning, and once before bed. We showed her how to do it once and she caught on fast. It's the perfect material and easy to hold with little fingers. There's no way the little bristles are coming off. Great tool to learn the concept of brushing! For reference, my baby just turned one :)
customer_reviews.author: thewoodsnest

customer_reviews.title: She loves teeth brushing time!
customer_reviews.text: My girl got two teeth on the early side, before she was 4 months. We wanted to establish good habits, and also keep her teeth and gums clean, but she's too young for toothpaste so we opted for this brush. She absolutely loves it! As soon as we walk into the bathroom she sees the banana brush and she breaks into a huge smile because she knows what's coming!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Szarlan

customer_reviews.title: My little one loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I had bought my son at least 4 other teethers and none of them kept him occupied like this banana does! He absolutely loves it. He chews on either end to reach way to the back gums and enjoys chewing on the handles to get those teeth coming in right up front. This is a great buy for your little one and I think a new staple gift for me to take to baby showers!
customer_reviews.author: Baggins

customer_reviews.title: One of my baby's favorite teething toys!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my baby's favorite teething toys! The important part is that she loves the bristles and the feeling she gets from it massaging her gums - but the best part of all is how FREAKING CUTE she looks holding this little banana! It's a must get for any teething baby! I love this for my daughter!
customer_reviews.author: GetFit NoExcuses

customer_reviews.title: All In The Family
customer_reviews.text: My daughter-in-laws niece hasn't taken hers out of her mouth since she started teething, so when my daughter in law put this on her baby registry, I added it to her goody bag. My grandson is only a few months old, and already holding this. The color? The shape? The size? Is it really banana flavored?? Whatever it is, babies love them. Get a couple!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M.

customer_reviews.title: The best teether out there!
customer_reviews.text: Baby loves this teether which also serves as a gum cleaner with the gentle silicone bristles. My baby is the pickiest when it comes to teether toys and this is his favorite! I ended up buying the corn on the cobb one too because he liked this one so much! I would highly recommend buying for that fussy teether.
customer_reviews.author: NCP

customer_reviews.title: Not a good toy.  Lint and hair
customer_reviews.text: If dropped on the floor or played with on carpet, it grabs all sorts of lint and debris. Granted, that this product is typically intended for brushing teeth and not as a toy. But it works as a toy, you just have to keep it off the floor. If it’s wet, it will grab all sorts of junk off the floor if it’s dropped. Yuck.
customer_reviews.author: cwink1

customer_reviews.title: Baby LOVES for teething, hard to clean/ keep hair off
customer_reviews.text: My 6mo absolutely loves this "toothbrush" for teething. It's super esay for her to hold on her own. She likes the bristle side, and the harder end for teething. My one major complaint is that it's SO hard to keep this teether clean. Everything sticks to the material of this teether, especially dog/ human hair. My baby drops this once, and I have to clean it off because of the amount of dog hair that gets on it. Overall, happy to have this product & would recommend for teething babies/ to practice the act of brushing teeth with baby.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my niece she's 7-8 months and I'm pretty sure she loves it. At first she wasn't sure how to hold it but after showing her a cpl times she's got the hang of it. Attracts lint and hair easily because of the material but it's pretty easy to clean. She was crying because she was teething but this seemed to soothe her gums when she would use it.
customer_reviews.author: D&C Brewster

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter absolutely loves this toy! We keep one at home and one in the diaper bag. It’s super easy for her to hold and we can attach rings/links and hook that to something so it doesn’t always hit the ground!
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: He seems to like it and grabs for it on his own
customer_reviews.text: I have observed my 8 month old grandson "gnawing away" on his Baby Banana, to help his teething. He seems to like it and grabs for it on his own. The resilient material is perfect for teething, with all soft, rounded edges. However, we do not condone it as a toothbrush; it merely simulates one for later brushing with a real toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: moldynorthwester

customer_reviews.title: Lil banana
customer_reviews.text: We use this as a fun teething toy for our baby. I do think that introducing this about a week before we began brushing her teeth has made her a lot more open minded about having her teeth brushed. She still uses this at 1 year old and I think she'll continue to do so as long as she's teething. The banana design is hysterical. People always crack up when they see her gnawing on it. I don't recommend using this as an actual toothbrush. A soft bristled brush works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GIFT FOR BABY SHOWER
customer_reviews.text: My son had one of these given to him as a baby and we LOVED it. He gnawed on it for several months! So, I bought this again when a cousin of mine was having her first baby. Great product. I would pay attention to the bristles on the top as my son chewed this thing until they were loose and about to come off. That's when we had the "Banana Fairy" come and take it away.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Gosa

customer_reviews.title: Daughters love this! Will stand by it.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My first daughter lovers it and used it for a very long time. I got this from Toys R Us when it was around and now we have another daughter, I searched forever for this and found it on Amazon, and my youngest daughter also loves it. I highly recommend this model. We tried to get a similar one from Wegmans, but this is the best version.
customer_reviews.author: SnapCrackleD

customer_reviews.title: Buy this whether your infant is teething or not!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 month old LOVES this. Might be the best baby product I have purchased so far. I'm not sure he's truly teething, but he loves to chew on things and has since he could put something in his mouth on his own. It is easy to clean, the little "peels" make it so you can use a pacifier clip and keep it on him and he chews on it happily. We never leave home without it.
customer_reviews.author: SideShowRobin

customer_reviews.title: 6 month old loves it
customer_reviews.text: He’s been using since he was 6 months. He’s almost 8 months now. No visible teeth yet, but he loves this toothbrush! I was hesitant to buy, because I didn’t understand what made it so cool, but I’m very happy I did! There are so many baby toys to choose from, but i am finding that the ones with the highest ratings are rated that way for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: A greta teething toy !!
customer_reviews.text: This banana brush has more than 7000 reviews and I totally agree with most of the people who have bought it for their kids. This is one of the best teething toys a child can have. Our little one used it whole day for a few months when she was having her first teeth. And it also inculcates the ha=bit of brushing in kids. Definitely a must-have toy for infants.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves!
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this toy! My parents’ dog did as well - beware that some dogs love these types of toys and chew them up. Not the easiest to teeth because of the bristles, but I love that this toy can go in the bathtub and easily be rinsed off.
customer_reviews.author: Sheridan F

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was my nieces favorite teether for months when she was teething and then learning to brush her teeth, so I got it for my 4 month old who is teething. He uses it all day and fusses less because he can actually get it in his mouth unlike other tethers that fall out and he loses!!
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie Marie

customer_reviews.title: My teething infant LOVES this!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for him as an Easter present knowing he was going to be teething soon. He absolutely LOVES this thing. If you put it in the fridge/freezer- even better! It's perfect for teething and starting out with brushing their "teeth." The bristles are very soft and flexible so they don't hurt him when he's chewing on it. The peel handles are the perfect size for him to hold onto as he plays with it. I highly recommend everyone give it a try with their little ones! P.S: Don't forget to sterilize it first before giving it to your baby :)
customer_reviews.author: Mikeila Sain

customer_reviews.title: Very entertaining
customer_reviews.text: Bought 1 several years ago and used it for all three kids. You can boil or steam it to sanitize. It’s held up well! I start them when they’re still toothless to get them used to the idea of brushing teeth, like in the video. It’s very entertaining, for mom anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Miffyspike

customer_reviews.title: Babys love it and look cute chewing on it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my daughter not knowing if she would enjoy it. However she loves the banana and chews on it. The tip almost has like a rubber toothbrush. The only con i have with this product is that it is hard to keep clean because the material. There are always little hairs that get attracted to it.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic swasey

customer_reviews.title: Great design but hard to keep clean
customer_reviews.text: My 6MO loved this teether- easy for her to grab and hold on to, and I liked that the shape prevents her from easily shoving it too far into her mouth. What I DIDN'T like is that the surface of this feels kind of tacky or sticky and it picked up EVERY little hair, fuzz and particle. It got dirty easily and wasn't something you can just blow or brush off, you need to rinse it or use a wet wipe.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Deschamps

customer_reviews.title: This thing is so awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: My 6th month old son loved this! we bought 2 and I gave one to the sitter but we lost ours. This is the only teether that he will use< I might have to break down and order another one. We tried everything and he doesn't like anything else so I was skeptical to buy this and I was so glad I did, I just wish we didn't lose it. Your child will love this!! It feels so good on their gums and they like to bite on them and they wont choke, greatest thing ever!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: ann Marchman

customer_reviews.title: Life saver teether/ brusher!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my son the Corn on the Cob. He LOVES it! He is having a really rough time with teething and this soothes his little gums. If this didn't work I didn't know what I was going to do for the little guy. I think he really enjoys the kernel texture on the corn than he would with any other. Very cool teether/ Brush. I will be purchasing this as a baby shower gift for my friends!
customer_reviews.author: chelsea

customer_reviews.title: This is a great training toothbrush!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little toothbrush and so does my daughter! My 11 month old now has 6 teeth and she loves to try to brush them. It's just flexible enough to be comfortable for her little hands and mouth, no rough edges or hard plastic to scrape herself with. She even turns it around and chews on the other side like a teether. The handles fit in her hands just like her cup handles so it was nothing to teach her to hold it. The rubber nubs/bristles are nice and flexible too, they seem to brush all around her teeth without hurting or getting stuck between like normal bristles could. This is a great training toothbrush!
customer_reviews.author: FancifulShopper

customer_reviews.title: Very cute and easy to hold
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to get my grandson accustomed to brushing. He has finally started getting his teeth but he has been chewing on this ever since he started teething. He chews on it and loves the bristles which is great. Very cute and easy for him to hold. I do supervise him when he is using it because he can gag on it. I got the Tom's toothpaste and he really likes that too - it only takes a dab of toothpaste at this point.
customer_reviews.author: MLG

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My baby is obsessed with this! We own two because he loves them so much. He will walk around and chew on the bristles and now as he gets older he "brushes". It is perfect for teething discomfort AND toothbrush training. A two in one!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan P

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Not worth for infants. I bought couple of other brushes for my son. This says that it has soft silicone bristles. Not agree at all. Bristles are very hard and can not be used by infants at all. Not recommended. All other brushes I got are fine and smooth but this one has bristles think and hard. I ordered this because of good reviews but could not like it.
customer_reviews.author: Vikusa

customer_reviews.title: Cute brush
customer_reviews.text: We bought this but have not used it, however, we trust the maker as we've been satisfied with their other products (teethers) so we expect the same from this as it appears well made. We will update the review if have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Danny E.

customer_reviews.title: Great infant teether and toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: My son has loved when I brush his teeth and gums with this. He’s also enjoyed the texture for teething. He’s been early to teeth, only downside it’s hard for him to hold onto himself with this little hands. Wish the handles were an easier grip for him
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Daughter Loves This Thing!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most ridiculous baby item I've purchased. It's also my daughter's favorite thing ever. I keep one in the car to have when I pick her up from daycare every day. She will open her mouth for you to use it to "brush" her two and a half teeth. And she looks so silly holding and chewing on it. Strangers love it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Farris

customer_reviews.title: Great teether formula little Monkey.
customer_reviews.text: This was a unique teether I purchased. Thought it would be funny for my little monkey to have something to knaw on and it being a banana. I bought this at 4 months. My son wasnt for sure about it but he did enjoy the silcon bristles when he did. Now he is 6 months old and loves it. Great buy overall. Keep in mind to watch your baby as they play with this teether due to them shoving it further in their mouth then they should.
customer_reviews.author: Bridgette

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We love this product. My babies always love it! It's easy to hold and to position in their mouths. It hits all the right gum spots. For both of my boys, this teether was and is their favorite. Great price too! Cheaper than the store in town.
customer_reviews.author: MommaJ15

customer_reviews.title: It’s great, but hair sticks to it
customer_reviews.text: My baby really likes this! And I love that it is a training toothbrush and teether! The only bad thing I have to say about it is hair sticks to it reeeeeally bad. I have to rinse it off every time she drops it - so anyone with a dog that sheds, watch out! If I’m giving baby a toy or teether now, I will usually reach for something else to give her just because this thing usually has hair stuck to it somewhere (or it will soon) and I just don’t want to deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: The best baby chew toy on the market!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to start using as a "toothbrush" for our 7 month old, and it immediately became her favorite chew toy. It's hard to get it out of her mouth when it's time to get out of the bath!! It's a classic for a reason, I guess. We're definitely going to buy the corn and whatever else they make. It feels so soft and chewy...I kinda want to gnaw on it.
customer_reviews.author: EmTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great for any age child who is teething
customer_reviews.text: We had one of these for my first son and then we lost it. For my second son we got another and he loves it just as much as the first. It is easy for babies to hold and they go to town chewing on it. My 2 year old likes to chew on it as well, and helps with those big molars coming in!
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: #1 baby product!
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS A MUST. I don’t even know what else to write. I have 2 children and this is my number one baby item. Way better than any other teething toy we have come across. Buy two. We put these on toy leashes or use a pacifier clip so that it’s always close to the baby.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Banana-shape is perfect! My teething boy loves this! Bought two- so one is always in the freezer!
customer_reviews.text: My teething baby loves this-- we bought two! I keep one in a container in the freezer so there is always a fresh one. We recently bought the Nuby toothbrush and paste and found that he's upset when I take the toothbrush away, so I started putting the toothpaste right onto the bristles of this teether and he loves to let me "brush" his teeth, and he keeps at it after I'm done, lol. Great product- its solid, I think that is what my son likes. And the bristles, and the side parts, and the thick bottom...heck, all of it!
customer_reviews.author: CSSW

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this!
customer_reviews.text: This a great toothbrush/teether. My baby boy loves it and it able to hold it well. It does attract a lot of hair from the material it's made out of, but I knew this before I purchased. Just have to wash it off. But it's very easy to clean so that's not much of a big deal to me. I also have no experienced any breakage of the bristles and my baby does have 2 teeth. I would recommend this for your little one.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly grady

customer_reviews.title: This Toothbrush/Teether is a Gem !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson as he has been having a rough time teething. Boy did it make a hit with him ! He's been chewing on that thing from the moment I gave it to him. The "Peel" handles are perfect and the toothbrush really helps massage the gums. Whoever thought of this is a genius !
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Manning

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best teething toys. My baby has had a long struggle with teething and this banana has been great. It’s easy to hold and the bristles are super soft while the other end is slightly harder for the gums. Would buy for the next baby and have purchased it for friends.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

product_meta.title: Baby Banana - Yellow Banana Toothbrush, Training Teether Tooth Brush for Infant, Baby, and Toddler
product_meta.description:
Color:YellowThe Baby Banana Infant Toothbrush gently massages little teeth and gums with soft silicone bristles, which helps develop good oral hygiene habits early. It has easy-to-grasp banana peel handles and is made of 100% flexible silicone to prevent mouth injuries.

BRAND STORY
By

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The flexible infant baby banana brush is the ideal infant training toothbrush that was invented by a mom-hygienist. The fun banana shape and soft texture are the perfect introduction and make brushing a fun experience as early as 3-4 months. It is made of the highest quality silicone and is compliant with the highest government standards. Because of its unique flexibility, it is much safer than traditional infant training toothbrushes and decreases risk of mouth injury. The wide banana peel handles provide an easy to grasp surface as infants learn to manipulate the brush in their mouth. The soft silicone can help sooth sore gums and it is dishwasher safe and freezer friendly. Parental supervision recommended.

See more
feature_bullets: GENTLE MASSAGING - Baby Banana toothbrushes gently massage teeth and gums. The soft, flexible brush helps protect young mouths that are still learning the habits of oral care. The peel handles make it easy to clean and prevent choking.

SOFT SILICONE - The flexible silicone material used to make these products help reduce the risk of mouth injury. These products are BPA, latex, and phthalate-free, so they are perfectly safe for babies and newborn children.

ORAL HYGIENE HABITS - Baby Banana training brushes help to develop good oral hygiene habits at a very young age. When not being used to cleanse your baby's mouth, the brush makes a great toy for playing and teething.

EASY TO CLEAN - Because these toothbrush teethers are made of silicone, they are dishwasher safe, making them super easy to clean! To help with a sore gum or mouth, these brushes can be placed in the freezer before use.

AGES 3 TO 12 MONTHS - Great for babies and infants, this toy works great for 12-month-old children and younger. Both boy and girl babies can enjoy the company of the Yellow Banana Brush as they develop and grow.
Now available in a variety of colors to suit any baby’s style

specifications.Material free: BPA Free, Phthalate Free, Latex Free
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars11,419 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
